alert.note: Alert for Clay; Cloud; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 4:27PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Clay, southwestern Washington and east central Cloud Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 427 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Clyde to near Idana. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clay Center, Clifton, Morganville, Green, Palmer, Vining and Idana. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
